taxonomyResolution.matchReasoning: Direct match to O*NET occupation. Financial Analysts conduct quantitative analyses of information involving investment programs or financial data of public or private institutions.

tasks.name: Data Collection & Aggregation
tasks.description: Gather financial data from multiple sources including databases, reports, and market feeds
tasks.reasoning: AI excels at systematic data collection, API integration, and aggregating information from structured sources. Current LLMs can parse financial documents and extract relevant metrics with high accuracy.

tasks.name: Financial Modeling
tasks.description: Build and maintain financial models for valuation, forecasting, and scenario analysis
tasks.reasoning: AI can assist with model construction and formula generation, but human judgment is essential for model assumptions, stress scenarios, and validation. The creative aspects of modeling require domain expertise.

tasks.name: Report Writing
tasks.description: Prepare written analyses, recommendations, and investment reports
tasks.reasoning: AI can draft initial reports and summarize findings, but nuanced interpretation, strategic recommendations, and stakeholder-specific communication require human expertise.

tasks.name: Stakeholder Presentations
tasks.description: Present findings to executives, clients, and investment committees
tasks.reasoning: Live presentations require reading the room, handling questions dynamically, building trust, and adapting messaging in real-time. These interpersonal elements remain firmly human domains.

tasks.name: Strategic Recommendations
tasks.description: Develop investment strategies and make buy/sell/hold recommendations
tasks.reasoning: While AI can surface data patterns, ultimate investment decisions require accountability, risk tolerance calibration, and integration of non-quantifiable factors. Fiduciary responsibility remains with humans.

automationExposure.summary: Financial Analyst roles face moderate automation exposure. Routine data tasks will be significantly automated, but core analytical judgment and stakeholder relationships remain human-centric.

skillImplications.rationale: Analysts who can effectively prompt AI systems, validate outputs, and integrate AI into workflows will dramatically outperform those who cannot. This is the new Excel proficiency.

skillImplications.futureOutlook: Differentiating skill as routine work automates
skillImplications.rationale: As AI handles more analytical grunt work, the ability to translate insights into compelling narratives and influence decisions becomes the primary value-add.
Advanced Excel skills are becoming table stakes rather than differentiators. AI can generate formulas and troubleshoot errors, reducing the premium on this skill.

methodology.title: Taxonomy Resolution
methodology.description: Job title mapped to O*NET Standard Occupational Classification for consistent task decomposition.
methodology.limitations: O*NET task lists may lag behind rapidly evolving job requirements

methodology.title: Task Decomposition
methodology.description: Role broken into constituent tasks using O*NET task statements and industry research.
methodology.dataSource: O*NET Task Statements, BLS Occupational Outlook
methodology.limitations: Task weighting is estimated based on typical role, may vary by organization

methodology.title: AI Capability Matching
methodology.description: Each task evaluated against current AI capabilities using standardized rubric.
methodology.dataSource: Internal capability framework based on published AI benchmarks
methodology.limitations: AI capabilities evolving rapidly; assessments reflect current state

methodology.title: Exposure Calculation
methodology.description: Weighted aggregation of task-level automation potential into overall exposure score.
methodology.limitations: Does not account for industry-specific adoption barriers

taxonomyResolution.matchReasoning: Direct match to O*NET occupation. Software Developers research, design, and develop computer and network software or specialized utility programs.

tasks.name: Code Writing
tasks.description: Write, test, and maintain code for software applications
tasks.reasoning: AI coding assistants can generate substantial code from natural language descriptions, but human oversight remains essential for architecture decisions, edge cases, and maintainability. Current tools excel at boilerplate but struggle with novel problems.

tasks.name: Debugging & Testing
tasks.description: Identify and fix software defects, write and maintain test suites
tasks.reasoning: AI can identify many bugs and suggest fixes, generate test cases, and catch common errors. However, complex logic bugs and understanding business requirements for testing need human judgment.

tasks.name: Documentation
tasks.description: Write technical documentation, API docs, and code comments
tasks.reasoning: AI excels at generating documentation from code, creating API references, and maintaining consistency. Human review ensures accuracy but generation is largely automated.

tasks.name: Requirements Analysis
tasks.description: Work with stakeholders to understand and document requirements
tasks.reasoning: Understanding what stakeholders actually need (vs. what they say) requires empathy, domain knowledge, and navigating organizational politics. AI can help document but not discover requirements.

tasks.name: System Architecture
tasks.description: Design system architecture and make technology choices
tasks.reasoning: Architecture decisions require understanding business constraints, team capabilities, future roadmaps, and making tradeoffs with incomplete information. AI can suggest patterns but not own decisions.

automationExposure.summary: Software development is being significantly augmented rather than replaced. Developers using AI tools will dramatically outproduce those who don't, but the role of architect and requirements analyst becomes more important.

skillImplications.rationale: Developers who master AI coding assistants see 30-50% productivity gains. Not adopting these tools is like refusing to use an IDE.
As AI handles more implementation, the ability to design systems that are maintainable, scalable, and aligned with business needs becomes the premium skill.

skillImplications.futureOutlook: Less valuable as AI handles implementation
skillImplications.rationale: The ability to quickly type out code is becoming less important than the ability to validate, refine, and integrate AI-generated code.

methodology.title: Taxonomy Resolution
methodology.description: Job title mapped to O*NET Standard Occupational Classification for consistent task decomposition.
methodology.limitations: Software development roles vary significantly across organizations

methodology.title: Task Decomposition
methodology.description: Role broken into constituent tasks using O*NET task statements and industry research.
methodology.dataSource: O*NET Task Statements, Stack Overflow Developer Survey
methodology.limitations: Task weighting based on typical full-stack role

methodology.title: AI Capability Matching
methodology.description: Each task evaluated against current AI capabilities including GitHub Copilot, Claude, GPT-4.
methodology.limitations: AI coding capabilities improving rapidly

methodology.title: Exposure Calculation
methodology.description: Weighted aggregation of task-level automation potential into overall exposure score.
methodology.limitations: Does not account for company-specific tooling restrictions

taxonomyResolution.matchReasoning: Direct match to O*NET occupation. Marketing Managers plan, direct, or coordinate marketing policies and programs.

tasks.name: Content Creation
tasks.description: Create marketing copy, social media posts, email campaigns, and other content
tasks.reasoning: AI can generate draft content quickly, but brand voice, strategic messaging, and creative differentiation require human creativity and judgment. AI is a force multiplier for content teams.

tasks.name: Campaign Analytics
tasks.description: Analyze campaign performance and derive insights
tasks.reasoning: AI excels at processing campaign data, identifying patterns, and generating performance reports. Interpretation and action still need humans but data processing is highly automatable.

tasks.name: Market Research
tasks.description: Conduct market research and competitive analysis
tasks.reasoning: AI can gather and synthesize vast amounts of market data, but interpreting implications, validating with primary research, and understanding nuances requires human judgment.

tasks.name: Strategy Development
tasks.description: Develop marketing strategy and brand positioning
tasks.reasoning: Marketing strategy requires understanding business objectives, competitive dynamics, customer psychology, and making bets on uncertain futures. This remains a deeply human activity.

tasks.name: Team & Agency Management
tasks.description: Lead marketing team and manage external agencies
tasks.reasoning: People management, performance coaching, and agency relationships are fundamentally human activities requiring emotional intelligence and interpersonal skills.

automationExposure.summary: Marketing Manager roles will see significant productivity gains from AI tools, particularly in content creation and analytics. Strategic and leadership aspects remain firmly human.

skillImplications.rationale: Marketers using AI for content creation and analysis will produce more with less. This is table stakes for modern marketing roles.
As tactical execution becomes more automated, the ability to set direction and make strategic bets becomes the core value of marketing leadership.
Spending hours building campaign reports will be seen as inefficient when AI can generate comprehensive dashboards instantly.

methodology.title: Taxonomy Resolution
methodology.description: Job title mapped to O*NET Standard Occupational Classification.
methodology.limitations: Marketing roles vary significantly by company size and industry

methodology.title: Task Decomposition
methodology.description: Role broken into constituent tasks using O*NET and marketing industry research.
methodology.limitations: B2B vs B2C marketing have different task distributions

methodology.title: AI Capability Matching
methodology.description: Tasks evaluated against generative AI and marketing automation capabilities.
methodology.dataSource: Analysis of tools like Jasper, Copy.ai, HubSpot AI
methodology.limitations: Tool capabilities vary significantly

methodology.title: Exposure Calculation
methodology.description: Weighted aggregation based on typical marketing manager time allocation.
methodology.limitations: Does not account for industry-specific factors

taxonomyResolution.matchReasoning: Direct match to O*NET occupation. Registered Nurses assess patient health problems and needs, develop and implement nursing care plans, and maintain medical records.

tasks.name: Documentation
tasks.description: Maintain patient medical records and documentation
tasks.reasoning: AI can significantly reduce documentation burden through voice-to-text, auto-population from monitoring systems, and intelligent form completion. Nurses spend 25%+ of time on documentation that can be largely automated.

tasks.name: Patient Monitoring
tasks.description: Monitor patient vital signs and condition
tasks.reasoning: AI-powered monitoring can detect anomalies and alert nurses, but human judgment is needed for interpretation and response. Technology augments rather than replaces vigilant care.

tasks.name: Patient Care Planning
tasks.description: Develop and update care plans based on patient needs
tasks.reasoning: AI can suggest evidence-based care protocols and flag inconsistencies, but nurses must tailor plans to individual patients considering factors AI cannot fully assess.

tasks.name: Direct Patient Care
tasks.description: Administer medications, treatments, and hands-on patient care
tasks.reasoning: Physical care delivery, patient interaction, and hands-on clinical tasks require human presence, dexterity, and judgment. Robotics may assist but cannot replace the nurse.

tasks.name: Patient & Family Communication
tasks.description: Educate patients and families, provide emotional support
tasks.reasoning: Empathetic communication during vulnerable moments, health education tailored to comprehension level, and emotional support are fundamentally human capabilities.

automationExposure.summary: Nursing has relatively low automation exposure due to the hands-on, interpersonal nature of the work. AI will primarily reduce administrative burden and enhance clinical decision support.

skillImplications.futureOutlook: Essential for effective AI tool use
skillImplications.rationale: Nurses who understand AI-powered monitoring, documentation systems, and clinical decision support will work more efficiently and catch AI errors.
As AI handles documentation and monitoring alerts, nurses can focus more on complex care coordination and patient advocacy.
Detailed manual charting will be replaced by voice transcription and automated capture, freeing time for patient care.

methodology.title: Taxonomy Resolution
methodology.description: Job title mapped to O*NET Standard Occupational Classification.
methodology.limitations: Nursing specialties have varying task distributions

methodology.title: Task Decomposition
methodology.description: Role broken into constituent tasks using nursing research.
methodology.dataSource: O*NET, ANA research on nursing time allocation
methodology.limitations: Hospital vs outpatient settings differ significantly

methodology.title: AI Capability Matching
methodology.description: Tasks evaluated against healthcare AI capabilities.
methodology.dataSource: FDA-approved AI devices, clinical decision support systems
methodology.limitations: Healthcare AI adoption faces regulatory constraints

methodology.title: Exposure Calculation
methodology.description: Weighted aggregation based on typical RN time allocation studies.
methodology.limitations: Regulatory and safety considerations slow AI adoption in healthcare

taxonomyResolution.matchReasoning: Direct match to O*NET occupation. Data Entry Keyers operate data entry devices to input data or codes into computers.

tasks.name: Data Entry
tasks.description: Enter data from source documents into computer systems
tasks.reasoning: OCR and AI document processing can extract data from structured and unstructured documents with high accuracy. This is the core use case for robotic process automation.

tasks.name: Data Verification
tasks.description: Verify accuracy of entered data
tasks.reasoning: AI can validate data against rules, flag anomalies, and cross-reference sources. Human review may be needed for edge cases but bulk verification is automated.

tasks.name: File Maintenance
tasks.description: Organize and maintain electronic and physical files
tasks.reasoning: Document management systems with AI can automatically classify, route, and organize files. Physical file handling is declining as organizations digitize.

tasks.name: Error Resolution
tasks.description: Investigate and resolve data discrepancies
tasks.reasoning: AI can flag and often suggest resolutions for discrepancies, but complex cases requiring judgment calls or external communication still need humans.

tasks.name: Process Improvement
tasks.description: Identify and suggest improvements to data entry processes
tasks.reasoning: Understanding process context, stakeholder needs, and practical implementation constraints requires human insight, though AI can surface inefficiency patterns.

automationExposure.summary: Data Entry Clerk is among the most exposed occupations to AI automation. Core tasks are highly automatable, and the role is likely to significantly decline or transform into exception handling.

skillImplications.rationale: Data entry workers who learn to configure and maintain automation tools can transition to process automation roles rather than being displaced.

skillImplications.futureOutlook: Remaining human role in automated processes
skillImplications.rationale: As bulk processing automates, the remaining work involves handling exceptions, edge cases, and errors that AI cannot resolve.
Raw data entry speed becomes irrelevant when AI can process documents faster than any human typist.

methodology.title: Taxonomy Resolution
methodology.description: Job title mapped to O*NET Standard Occupational Classification.
methodology.limitations: Data entry roles vary by industry and data type

methodology.title: Task Decomposition
methodology.description: Role broken into constituent tasks using O*NET and RPA research.
methodology.dataSource: O*NET Task Statements, RPA vendor case studies
methodology.limitations: Assumes primarily digital data sources

methodology.title: AI Capability Matching
methodology.description: Tasks evaluated against document AI and RPA capabilities.
methodology.dataSource: Analysis of AWS Textract, Google Document AI, UiPath
methodology.limitations: Accuracy depends heavily on document quality

methodology.title: Exposure Calculation
methodology.description: Weighted aggregation based on typical data entry time allocation.
methodology.limitations: Legacy systems may slow automation adoption
